subtitle: This quick and easy stir-fry makes an ideal weekday family meal.

method.text: Mix together all the sauce ingredients. Set aside.

Heat the oil in a large frying pan or wok. Add the bacon and cook over a fairly high heat for 5-6 min, stirring regularly until lightly browned. Remove from the pan with a slotted spoon and set aside.
Melt the butter in the pan. Stir in the celery, peppers and carrots. Cook, stirring constantly, for 2-3 min. Add the Chinese leaves, cashew nuts and salad onions and cook for 1 min.
Return the bacon to the pan and pour over the sauce, stirring until thickened. Warm the pitta bread. Cut a slit in the side of each pitta bread and fill with the stir-fry. Serve immediately.

title: Bacon stir-fry in pitta pockets
